Data Structures | Macros | Functions | Variables
APS12804O MSPI PSRAM Driver
devices

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides a hardware abstraction layer for the APS12804O Multi-bit SPI PSRAM device. It enables high-speed DDR read/write operations, XIP functionality, and power management for embedded applications requiring external volatile memory. The driver supports efficient data access, timing optimization, scrambling, and system integration for optimal PSRAM performance.

Key Features

  1. High-speed DDR Access: Quad SPI DDR mode for maximum throughput.
  2. XIP Mode: Execute code directly from PSRAM memory space.
  3. DMA Support: Efficient non-blocking data transfer operations.
  4. Scrambling Support: Hardware-based data scrambling for security.
  5. Power Management: Half-sleep mode for reduced power consumption.
  6. Timing Calibration: Automatic timing optimization and validation.
  7. High-priority Operations: Support for priority-based read/write access.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure APS12804O device with DDR timing
  • Perform blocking and non-blocking read/write operations
  • Handle advanced read/write operations with DMA support
  • Manage XIP mode configuration and control
  • Control data scrambling for enhanced security
  • Implement power management with half-sleep modes
  • Calibrate and optimize timing parameters
  • Support high-priority memory access operations

Usage

  1. Initialize device with am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_init()
  2. Perform timing calibration with am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_init_timing_check()
  3. Read/write data using blocking APIs (ddr_read/ddr_write) or non-blocking APIs
  4. Enable XIP mode with am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_enable_xip()
  5. Configure scrambling if needed with enable/disable scrambling functions
  6. Use power management features like half-sleep mode for energy efficiency
  7. Deinitialize with am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_deinit() when done

Configuration

  • Set up MSPI interface with DDR timing parameters
  • Configure DMA for high-performance data transfers
  • Enable DDR mode with optimized timing settings
  • Configure scrambling parameters for secure operations
  • Set up power management modes and wake-up sequences
  • Optimize timing calibration for different operating conditions

Global definitions for psram commands

#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_RSTEN   0x6666
 
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_RST   0x9999
 
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_READ   0x8B8B
 
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_WRITE   0x8282
 
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_READ_REGISTER   0xB5B5
 
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_WRITE_REGISTER   0xB1B1
 
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_HALFSLEEP_ENTRY   0xC0C0
 

Device specific identification.

Note
The following definitions are typically specific to a multibit spi psram device. They should be tailored
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_PAGE_SIZE   2048
 
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_TEST_BLOCK_SIZE   8*2048
 

Global definitions for the MSPI instance to use.

#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_MAX_DEVICE_NUM   AM_REG_MSPI_NUM_MODULES

◆ am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_id()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_id ( void * pHandle)

Reads the ID of the external psram and returns the value.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to the psram device handle

This function reads the device ID register of the external psram, and returns the result as an 32-bit unsigned integer value.

Returns
32-bit status or 16-bit ID

◆ am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_init()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_init ( uint32_t ui32Module,
am_devices_mspi_psram_config_t * pDevCfg,
void ** ppHandle,
void ** ppMspiHandle )

Initialize the mspi_psram driver.

Parameters
ui32Module- MSPI instance
pDevCfg- MSPI device structure describing the target spi psram.
ppHandle- Device handle which needs to be return
ppMspiHandle- MSPI handle which needs to be return

This function should be called before any other am_devices_mspi_psram functions. It is used to set tell the other functions how to communicate with the external psram hardware.

Returns
status.

◆ am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_nonblocking_read()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_nonblocking_read ( void * pHandle,
uint8_t * pui8RxBuffer,
uint32_t ui32ReadAddress,
uint32_t ui32NumBytes,
am_hal_mspi_callback_t pfnCallback,
void * pCallbackCtxt )

Reads the contents of the external psram into a buffer.

Parameters
pHandle- MSPI Device handle.
pui8RxBuffer- Buffer to store the received data from the psram
ui32ReadAddress- Address of desired data in external psram
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to read from external psram
pfnCallback
pCallbackCtxt

This function reads the external psram at the provided address and stores the received data into the provided buffer location. This function will only store ui32NumBytes worth of data.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_read()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_read ( void * pHandle,
uint8_t * pui8RxBuffer,
uint32_t ui32ReadAddress,
uint32_t ui32NumBytes,
bool bWaitForCompletion )

Reads the contents of the external PSRAM into a buffer.

Parameters
pHandle- MSPI Device handle.
pui8RxBuffer- Buffer to store the received data from the PSRAM
ui32ReadAddress- Address of desired data in external PSRAM
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to read from external PSRAM
bWaitForCompletion- Wait for transaction completion before exiting

This function reads the external PSRAM at the provided address and stores the received data into the provided buffer location. This function will only store ui32NumBytes worth of data. If the bWaitForCompletion is true, then the function will poll for DMA completion indication flag before returning.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_read_adv()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_read_adv ( void * pHandle,
uint8_t * pui8RxBuffer,
uint32_t ui32ReadAddress,
uint32_t ui32NumBytes,
uint32_t ui32PauseCondition,
uint32_t ui32StatusSetClr,
am_hal_mspi_callback_t pfnCallback,
void * pCallbackCtxt )

Reads the contents of the external PSRAM into a buffer.

Parameters
pHandle- MSPI Device handle.
pui8RxBuffer- Buffer to store the received data from the PSRAM
ui32ReadAddress- Address of desired data in external PSRAM
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to read from external PSRAM
ui32PauseCondition- Pause condition before transaction is executed
ui32StatusSetClr- Post-transaction CQ condition
pfnCallback- Post-transaction callback function
pCallbackCtxt- Post-transaction callback context

This function reads the external PSRAM at the provided address and stores the received data into the provided buffer location. This function will only store ui32NumBytes worth of data. The Command Queue pre and post transaction conditions and a callback function and context are also provided.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_write()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_ddr_write ( void * pHandle,
uint8_t * pui8TxBuffer,
uint32_t ui32WriteAddress,
uint32_t ui32NumBytes,
bool bWaitForCompletion )

Programs the given range of psram addresses.

Parameters
pHandle- Device handle of the external psram
ui32DeviceNumber- Device number of the external psram
pui8TxBuffer- Buffer to write the external psram data from
ui32WriteAddress- Address to write to in the external psram
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to write to the external psram

This function uses the data in the provided pui8TxBuffer and copies it to the external psram at the address given by ui32WriteAddress. It will copy exactly ui32NumBytes of data from the original pui8TxBuffer pointer. The user is responsible for ensuring that they do not overflow the target psram memory or underflow the pui8TxBuffer array

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_enter_halfsleep()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_psram_aps12804o_enter_halfsleep ( void * pHandle)

Function to Enter Half Sleep.

Parameters
pHandle- Handle to the PSRAM.

Send a command to Enter Half Sleep Mode. Will need to Be in OCTAL mode to access the register per the device driver.

Returns
32-bit status

Function to Exit Half Sleep.

Parameters
pHandle- Handle to the PSRAM.

This function resets the device to bring it out of halfsleep

◆ APS128DDRQuadMSPIConfig

am_hal_mspi_dev_config_t APS128DDRQuadMSPIConfig
Initial value:
=
{
.eAddrCfg = AM_HAL_MSPI_ADDR_3_BYTE,
.eInstrCfg = AM_HAL_MSPI_INSTR_2_BYTE,
.ui16ReadInstr = AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_READ,
.ui16WriteInstr = AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_WRITE,
.eDeviceConfig = AM_HAL_MSPI_FLASH_QUAD_DDR_CE0,
.eSpiMode = AM_HAL_MSPI_SPI_MODE_0,
.bSendAddr = true,
.bSendInstr = true,
.bTurnaround = true,
.eClockFreq = AM_HAL_MSPI_CLK_96MHZ,
.ui8TurnAround = 5,
.ui8WriteLatency = 4,
.bEnWriteLatency = true,
.bEmulateDDR = true,
.ui16DMATimeLimit = 40,
.eDMABoundary = AM_HAL_MSPI_BOUNDARY_BREAK1K,
}

{
.bDQSEnable = 1,
